Drinking at Meals. 
     409. Taken with meals, water diminishes the flow of the salivary glands; and the colder the water the greater the injury to the stomach. Ice water or iced lemonade, drunk with meals, will arrest digestion until the system has imparted sufficient warmth 
                                                                           90
to the stomach to enable it to take up its work again.-- R. and H., 1884, No. 31.
